publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6181 Stuart McMillan: Inverclyde Choirs Raise Money for Haiti—That the Parliament congratulates the combined Inverclyde choirs for raising £6,500 to help victims of the Haiti earthquake; notes that pupils from Inverclyde schools’ junior and senior choirs and the adult choir, Inverclyde Voices, took part in Sing for Haiti held in Greenock Town Hall on 5 March 2010; acknowledges that the money has been sent to the charity, Mary’s Meals, to help with the building of schools and feeding of children and orphans of Haiti, and congratulates the choirs on their great accomplishment. Supported by: Brian Adam*, Aileen Campbell*, Stewart Maxwell*, Sandra White*, Trish Godman*
S3M-6181 Inverclyde Choirs Raise Money for Haiti (lodged on 21 April 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Rob Gibson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Wilson*, Bob Doris*, Gil Paterson*
